channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Russian warship: Moskva crew 'shown for first time since sinking'
item.description: Russia's defence ministry releases a video purportedly showing the crew of the Moskva in Sevastopol.

item.title: Ukraine war: Trucks stuck at Poland-Belarus border as EU sanctions deadline passes
item.description: An 80km queue formed on the Polish border ahead of a deadline for Russian trucks to leave the EU.

item.title: Ukraine war scams: Cybercriminals stole my identity
item.description: Scammers are using emotionally charged tricks in a bid to steal online donations.

item.title: UK's Rwanda asylum plan the 'opposite of nature of God' - Welby
item.description: There were "serious ethical questions" over sending migrants to east Africa, Justin Welby says.

item.title: North Korea tests new weapon 'to improve tactical nukes'
item.description: Kim Jong-un clapped as he watched the launch - a new indication of his intention to resume nuclear tests.

item.title: Unrest in Sweden over planned Quran burnings
item.description: There is ongoing unrest over a far-right group which burned a copy of the Quran, and planned to do so again.

item.title: Angella Okutoyi: Kenya's rising tennis star
item.description: After playing in the Australian Open, could Kenyan Angella Okutoyi emulate her hero Serena Williams?

item.title: South Africa flooding: 'I had thought my house was safe'
item.description: Torrential floods have killed nearly 400 people in South Africa, with more rain forecast.

item.title: Johnson to visit India in bid to boost defence ties
item.description: The prime minister will meet his Indian counterpart after previous visits were postponed due to Covid.

item.title: Climate change: Key UN finding widely misinterpreted
item.description: Suggestions emissions could rise for another three years without dangerous warming are wrong, scientists say.

item.title: Covid China: Elderly deaths contradict Shanghai figures
item.description: Official figures claim there have been no Covid deaths in the current outbreak.

item.title: Tropical Storm Megi: Landslides and floods kill 167 in Philippines
item.description: Tropical Storm Megi devastated the country on Sunday, with houses washed out to sea in one village.

item.title: Undocumented lotto winner struggles to claim prize
item.description: An Algerian man in Belgium is fighting to claim his â‚¬250,000 winnings because of his status.

item.title: Climate change: 'We're making wine in Norway'
item.description: Vineyards are moving further north, but new winemakers say they struggle to be taken seriously.

item.title: Nigeria's Chibok girls: Why was this former captive treated differently?
item.description: Hassana Adamu speaks to the BBC about feeling neglected on the eighth anniversary of the kidnappings.

item.title: Patrick Lyoya: Could rethink of US police traffic stops save lives?
item.description: The death of a black man in Michigan after a traffic stop raises questions about police use of force.

item.title: DR Congo conflict: Hiding on top of a hill to escape the rebels
item.description: Some 50,000 people have found a place of sanctuary from the myriad armed groups in eastern DR Congo.

item.title: Week in pictures: 9-15 April 2022
item.description: A selection of striking images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

item.title: Merle Oberon: India's forgotten Hollywood star
item.description: Merle Oberon rose to stardom in the West while furtively hiding the truth of her past in India.

item.title: Sanctioned Russian oligarchs linked to Â£800m worth of UK property
item.description: A dozen sanctioned Russians are linked to an estimated Â£800m worth of property in the UK, BBC analysis reveals.

item.title: Durban floods: Is it a consequence of climate change?
item.description: KwaZulu-Natal province has seen some serious flooding, but there isn't one clear explanation.

item.title: Invictus Games: Prince Harry and Meghan join opening ceremony in the Netherlands
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have not been on this side of the Atlantic together since 2020.

item.title: Chernihiv is silent, after having been under constant attack from Russian forces
item.description: The Ukrainian city of Chernihiv was under constant attack until suddenly Russian forces withdrew.

item.title: Ukraine war: Minesweeping dog helps clear Chernihiv of Russian explosives
item.description: Patron, a Jack Russell, has so far helped to remove hundreds of explosive devices.

item.title: US zoo celebrates 50 years of giant pandas
item.description: The tradition of gifted pandas to the US from China hits a 50-year mark at Washington DC's National Zoo.

item.title: Former Twitter exec questions seriousness of Musk offer
item.description: Vivian Schiller, who used to work there, tells Newsnight Elon Musk enjoys "throwing bombs" on Twitter.
